item.title: Welcome, Epics!
item.description: We’ve been working for some time doing Continuous Delivery in our teams, and we found that managing feature toggles in our code was a challenge. Not only because toggles are complex to implement properly and each of us implemented their toggles in different ways, but also because toggles evolved rapidly when we were releasing new features. A good example of the evolution of a toggle would be to, first, enable our new shiny feature for a subset of users.
